Package model

Class DataHolder

java.lang.Object
model.DataHolder
public class DataHolder extends Object
This class contains static Observable Lists as well as static (and a few non-static) methods that are used throughout the application.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointments>
    listOfAllAppointments
    All appointment records that are currently in the Appointments database table.
    private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Contacts>
    listOfAllContacts
    All records that are currently in the Contacts database table.
    private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Countries>
    listOfAllCountries
    All records that are currently in the Countries database table.
    private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customers>
    listOfAllCustomers
    All records that are currently in the Customers database table.
    private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<FirstLevelDivisions>
    listOfAllDivisionsOfACertainCountry
    The list of all first-level divisions (records from the First_Level_Divisions database table) that are in the given country (the country ID of the country to use is given as a parameter when calling this variable's getter method).
    private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Users>
    listOfAllUsers
    All records that are currently in the Users database table.
    private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointments>
    listOfThisMonthsAppointments
    All appointment records (that is, records from the database's Appointments table) that are scheduled for the current month.
    private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointments>
    listOfThisWeeksAppointments
    All appointment records (that is, records from the database's Appointments table) that are scheduled for the current week (Sunday to Saturday, inclusive).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static String
    convert24HourTimeTo12HourTime(String timeIn24HourFormat)
    This method takes in a time in 24-hour format (in the configuration HH:MM, HH:MM:SS, or HH:MM:SS.ns [with or without a leading zero for the hour value]) and converts it to the same time in 12-hour format (HH:MM along with AM or PM) without a leading zero for the hour value if the hour value is a single digit.
    static Timestamp
    convertMDYdateAndHMStimeToTimestamp(String date, String time)
    This method takes in a date in the format MM/DD/YYYY (with or without a leading zero for the month and day values) and a time in the format HH:MM:SS or HH:MM:SS.ns ("ns" stands for "nanoseconds"); it returns a Timestamp variable created from these two parameters.
    static String
    convertMDYdateToYMDdate(String date)
    This method takes in a date in MM/DD/YYYY format (with or without a leading zero for the month and day values) and converts it to YYYY-MM-DD format (with a leading zero added to the month and day values if they only consist of one digit).
    static String
    convertYMDdateToDMYdate(String date)
    This method takes in a date in YYYY-MM-DD format (with or without a leading zero for the month and day values) and converts it to DD/MM/YYYY format (with a leading zero added to the month and day values if they only consist of one digit).
    static String
    convertYMDdateToMDYdate(String date)
    This method takes in a date in YYYY-MM-DD format (with or without a leading zero for the month and day values) and converts it to MM/DD/YYYY format (with any leading zeros in the month and day values removed).
    static String
    getDayAfterMDYDate(String date)
    This method takes in a date in MM/DD/YYYY format (with or without a leading zero for the month and day values) and calculates the date of the day after that given date.
    static Timestamp
    getFirstDayOfNextWeekAtStartOfDay()
    This method calculates the Timestamp (meaning the date and time) of the first day of next week (next Sunday, even if today is Sunday), at the beginning of that day (midnight).
    static Timestamp
    getFirstDayOfThisWeekAtStartOfDay()
    This method calculates the Timestamp (meaning the date and time) of the first day of the current week (the Sunday directly previous to today, or today if it is currently Sunday), at the beginning of that day (midnight).
    static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointments>
    getListOfAllAppointments()
    The getter (accessor) method for this class's "listOfAllAppointments" variable.

    void
    switchToDifferentSceneAndSendDataToThatSceneUsingButton(javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader loader, javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method switches the current visible screen to the FXML file (UI screen) that is loaded up in the FXMLLoader (the first parameter of this method); this method only works if the event that triggered the screen switch came from a button.
    void
    switchToDifferentSceneAndSendDataToThatSceneUsingTextField(javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader loader, javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method switches the current visible screen to the FXML file (UI screen) that is loaded up in the FXMLLoader (the first parameter of this method); this method only works if the event that triggered the screen switch came from a text field (for example, if the user's cursor was in a certain text field, and they then hit the "Enter" key on their keyboard).

    This method switches the current visible screen to the FXML file (UI screen) indicated in the first parameter; this method only works if the event that triggered the screen switch came from a button.
    void
    switchToDifferentSceneUsingTextField(String urlOfDestinationScene, javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method switches the current visible screen to the FXML file (UI screen) indicated in the first parameter; this method only works if the event that triggered the screen switch came from a text field (for example, if the user's cursor was in a certain text field, and they then hit the "Enter" key on their keyboard).

  • Field Details

    • listOfAllAppointments

      private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointments> listOfAllAppointments
      All appointment records that are currently in the Appointments database table. Each appointment record is held in an object of type Appointments; these objects are contained within an Observable List.

    • listOfThisMonthsAppointments

      private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointments> listOfThisMonthsAppointments
      All appointment records (that is, records from the database's Appointments table) that are scheduled for the current month. Each appointment record is held in an object of type Appointments; these objects are contained within an Observable List.

    • listOfThisWeeksAppointments

      private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointments> listOfThisWeeksAppointments
      All appointment records (that is, records from the database's Appointments table) that are scheduled for the current week (Sunday to Saturday, inclusive). Each appointment record is held in an object of type Appointments; these objects are contained within an Observable List.

    • listOfAllContacts

      private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Contacts> listOfAllContacts
      All records that are currently in the Contacts database table. Each contact record is held in an object of type Contacts; these objects are contained within an Observable List.

    • listOfAllCountries

      private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Countries> listOfAllCountries
      All records that are currently in the Countries database table. Each country record is held in an object of type Countries; these objects are contained within an Observable List.

    • listOfAllCustomers

      private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customers> listOfAllCustomers
      All records that are currently in the Customers database table. Each customer record is held in an object of type Customers; these objects are contained within an Observable List.

    • listOfAllDivisionsOfACertainCountry

      private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<FirstLevelDivisions> listOfAllDivisionsOfACertainCountry
      The list of all first-level divisions (records from the First_Level_Divisions database table) that are in the given country (the country ID of the country to use is given as a parameter when calling this variable's getter method). Each division record in this list is housed in an object of type FirstLevelDivisions; these objects are contained within an Observable List.

    • listOfAllUsers

      private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Users> listOfAllUsers
      All records that are currently in the Users database table. Each user record is held in an object of type Users; these objects are contained within an Observable List.

    • DataHolder

      public DataHolder()

  • Method Details

    • convertMDYdateAndHMStimeToTimestamp

      public static Timestamp convertMDYdateAndHMStimeToTimestamp(String date, String time)
      This method takes in a date in the format MM/DD/YYYY (with or without a leading zero for the month and day values) and a time in the format HH:MM:SS or HH:MM:SS.ns ("ns" stands for "nanoseconds"); it returns a Timestamp variable created from these two parameters.
      Parameters:
      date - A date in the format MM/DD/YYYY (with or without leading zeros in the month and day values)
      time - A time in the format HH:MM:SS or HH:MM:SS.ns ("ns" stands for "nanoseconds"); the time must be in 24-hour format
      Returns:
      Returns a Timestamp variable created from the given parameters

    • convertMDYdateToYMDdate

      public static String convertMDYdateToYMDdate(String date)
      This method takes in a date in MM/DD/YYYY format (with or without a leading zero for the month and day values) and converts it to YYYY-MM-DD format (with a leading zero added to the month and day values if they only consist of one digit).
      Parameters:
      date - A date in the format MM/DD/YYYY (with or without a leading zero for the month and day values)
      Returns:
      Returns the given date in the format YYYY-MM-DD (with a leading zero added to the month and day values if they only consist of one digit)

    • convertYMDdateToMDYdate

      public static String convertYMDdateToMDYdate(String date)
      This method takes in a date in YYYY-MM-DD format (with or without a leading zero for the month and day values) and converts it to MM/DD/YYYY format (with any leading zeros in the month and day values removed).
      Parameters:
      date - A date in the format YYYY-MM-DD (with or without a leading zero for the month and day values)
      Returns:
      Returns the given date in the format MM/DD/YYYY (with any leading zeros in the month and day values removed)

    • convertYMDdateToDMYdate

      public static String convertYMDdateToDMYdate(String date)
      This method takes in a date in YYYY-MM-DD format (with or without a leading zero for the month and day values) and converts it to DD/MM/YYYY format (with a leading zero added to the month and day values if they only consist of one digit).
      Parameters:
      date - A date in the format YYYY-MM-DD (with or without a leading zero for the month and day values)
      Returns:
      Returns the given date in the format DD/MM/YYYY (with a leading zero added to the month and day values if they only consist of one digit)

    • convert24HourTimeTo12HourTime

      public static String convert24HourTimeTo12HourTime(String timeIn24HourFormat)
      This method takes in a time in 24-hour format (in the configuration HH:MM, HH:MM:SS, or HH:MM:SS.ns [with or without a leading zero for the hour value]) and converts it to the same time in 12-hour format (HH:MM along with AM or PM) without a leading zero for the hour value if the hour value is a single digit.
      Parameters:
      timeIn24HourFormat - The time to be converted (its format must be HH:MM, HH:MM:SS, or HH:MM:SS.ns [with or without a leading zero for the hour value])
      Returns:
      Returns the given time converted to 12-hour format (HH:MM along with AM or PM) without a leading zero for the hour value if the hour value is a single digit

    • getDayAfterMDYDate

      public static String getDayAfterMDYDate(String date)
      This method takes in a date in MM/DD/YYYY format (with or without a leading zero for the month and day values) and calculates the date of the day after that given date.
      Parameters:
      date - The date whose next day (in date form) will be calculated
      Returns:
      The date of the day after the given parameter (in MM/DD/YYYY format, without any leading zero for the month and day values)

    • getFirstDayOfThisWeekAtStartOfDay

      public static Timestamp getFirstDayOfThisWeekAtStartOfDay()
      This method calculates the Timestamp (meaning the date and time) of the first day of the current week (the Sunday directly previous to today, or today if it is currently Sunday), at the beginning of that day (midnight).
      Returns:
      Returns the Timestamp representing the date of the first day of the current week (at the start of that day)

    • getFirstDayOfNextWeekAtStartOfDay

      public static Timestamp getFirstDayOfNextWeekAtStartOfDay()
      This method calculates the Timestamp (meaning the date and time) of the first day of next week (next Sunday, even if today is Sunday), at the beginning of that day (midnight).
      Returns:
      Returns the Timestamp representing the date of the first day of next week (at the start of that day)

    • getLocaleOfCurrentUser

      public static Locale getLocaleOfCurrentUser()
      This method returns a Locale variable representing the locale of the current user.
      Returns:
      Returns a Locale variable representing the locale of the current user

    • switchToDifferentSceneUsingButton

      public void switchToDifferentSceneUsingButton(String urlOfDestinationScene, javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method switches the current visible screen to the FXML file (UI screen) indicated in the first parameter; this method only works if the event that triggered the screen switch came from a button.
      Parameters:
      urlOfDestinationScene - The URL of the FXML file (UI screen) that the user will be switched to
      event - The action that occurred that caused the scene to switch (e.g. a certain button was clicked)
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader's "load()" method (if an error occurs while loading the desired scene)

    • switchToDifferentSceneUsingTextField

      public void switchToDifferentSceneUsingTextField(String urlOfDestinationScene, javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method switches the current visible screen to the FXML file (UI screen) indicated in the first parameter; this method only works if the event that triggered the screen switch came from a text field (for example, if the user's cursor was in a certain text field, and they then hit the "Enter" key on their keyboard).
      Parameters:
      urlOfDestinationScene - The URL of the FXML file (UI screen) that the user will be switched to
      event - The action that occurred that caused the scene to switch (e.g. the user's cursor was in a certain text field, and they then hit the "Enter" key on their keyboard)
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader's "load()" method (if an error occurs while loading the desired scene)

    • switchToDifferentSceneAndSendDataToThatSceneUsingButton

      public void switchToDifferentSceneAndSendDataToThatSceneUsingButton(javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader loader, javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method switches the current visible screen to the FXML file (UI screen) that is loaded up in the FXMLLoader (the first parameter of this method); this method only works if the event that triggered the screen switch came from a button. Additionally, this method is only used when the old scene (UI screen) must send data to the new scene.
      Parameters:
      loader - An FXMLLoader object that has the FXML file (UI screen) to switch to already loaded up inside of it
      event - The action that occurred that caused the scene to switch (e.g. a certain button was clicked)

    • switchToDifferentSceneAndSendDataToThatSceneUsingTextField

      public void switchToDifferentSceneAndSendDataToThatSceneUsingTextField(javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader loader, javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method switches the current visible screen to the FXML file (UI screen) that is loaded up in the FXMLLoader (the first parameter of this method); this method only works if the event that triggered the screen switch came from a text field (for example, if the user's cursor was in a certain text field, and they then hit the "Enter" key on their keyboard). Additionally, this method is only used when the old scene (UI screen) must send data to the new scene.
      Parameters:
      loader - An FXMLLoader object that has the FXML file (UI screen) to switch to already loaded up inside of it
      event - The action that occurred that caused the scene to switch (e.g. the user's cursor was in a certain text field, and they then hit the "Enter" key on their keyboard)

    • getListOfAllAppointments

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointments> getListOfAllAppointments()
      The getter (accessor) method for this class's "listOfAllAppointments" variable.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all appointment records that are currently in the Appointments database table. Each appointment record is held in an object of type Appointments; these objects are contained within the Observable List that is being returned.

    • getListOfThisMonthsAppointments

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointments> getListOfThisMonthsAppointments()
      The getter (accessor) method for this class's "listOfThisMonthsAppointments" variable.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all appointment records from the Appointments database table that are scheduled for the current month. Each appointment record is held in an object of type Appointments; these objects are contained within the Observable List that is being returned.

    • getListOfThisWeeksAppointments

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointments> getListOfThisWeeksAppointments()
      The getter (accessor) method for this class's "listOfThisWeeksAppointments" variable.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all appointment records from the Appointments database table that are scheduled for the current week (Sunday to Saturday, inclusive). Each appointment record is held in an object of type Appointments; these objects are contained within the Observable List that is being returned.

    • getListOfAllContacts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Contacts> getListOfAllContacts()
      The getter (accessor) method for this class's "listOfAllContacts" variable.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all contact records that are currently in the Contacts database table. Each contact record is housed in an object of type Contacts; these objects are contained within the Observable List that is being returned.

    • getListOfAllCountries

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Countries> getListOfAllCountries()
      The getter (accessor) method for this class's "listOfAllCountries" variable.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all country records that are currently in the Countries database table. Each country record is housed in an object of type Countries; these objects are contained within the Observable List that is being returned.

    • getListOfAllCustomers

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customers> getListOfAllCustomers()
      The getter (accessor) method for this class's "listOfAllCustomers" variable.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all customer records that are currently in the Customers database table. Each customer record is housed in an object of type Customers; these objects are contained within the Observable List that is being returned.

    • getListOfAllDivisionsOfACertainCountry

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<FirstLevelDivisions> getListOfAllDivisionsOfACertainCountry(int idOfCountry)
      The getter (accessor) method for this class's "listOfAllDivisionsOfACertainCountry" variable.
      Parameters:
      idOfCountry - The country ID of the country whose first-level divisions will be returned
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all division records that are linked to the country whose country ID was input as a parameter (in more colloquial language, the list is a list of all first-level divisions that are in the given country). Each division record is housed in an object of type FirstLevelDivisions; these objects are contained within the Observable List that is being returned.

    • getListOfAllUsers

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Users> getListOfAllUsers()
      The getter (accessor) method for this class's "listOfAllUsers" variable.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all user records that are currently in the Users database table. Each user record is housed in an object of type Users; these objects are contained within the Observable List that is being returned.
